member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Expand
member.summary: Expands the node.
member.remarks: The Expand method expands the current Node down to the next level of nodes. The state of a Node is persisted. For example, if the next level of child nodes was not collapsed previously, when the Expand method is called, the child nodes appear in their previously expanded state.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Expand(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.eTreeAction)
member.summary: Expands the node.
member.remarks: The Expand method expands the current Node down to the next level of nodes. The state of a Node is persisted. For example, if the next level of child nodes was not collapsed previously, when the Expand method is called, the child nodes appear in their previously expanded state.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ExpandAll
member.summary: Expands all the child tree nodes.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Remove
member.summary: Removes the current node from the control.
member.remarks: When the Remove method is called, the node and any child nodes assigned to the Node are removed from the Tree. The removed child nodes are removed from the Tree, but are still attached to this node.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Remove(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.eTreeAction)
member.summary: Removes the current node from the control and provides information about source of action
member.remarks: When the Remove method is called, the node and any child nodes assigned to the Node are removed from the Tree. The removed child nodes are removed from the Tree, but are still attached to this node.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles the node to either the expanded or collapsed state.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Toggle(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.eTreeAction)
member.summary: Toggles the node to either the expanded or collapsed state.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ToString
member.summary: Returns string representation of the Node.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnCellInserted(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Cell)
member.summary: Called after new cell has been added to Cells collection.
member.param: Reference to the new cell added.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnCellRemoved(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Cell)
member.summary: Called after cell has been removed from Cells collection.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnSizeChanged
member.summary: Occurs when property on the node has changed that influences the size of the node.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnImageChanged
member.summary: Occurs when any image property for the cell has changed.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnChildNodesSizeChanged
member.summary: Occurs when size of the child nodes has changed.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnDisplayChanged
member.summary: Called when visual part of the node has changed due to the changes of its properties or properties of the cells contained by node.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnChildNodeInserted(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node)
member.summary: Called after new node has been added to Nodes collection.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.OnChildNodeRemoved(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node)
member.summary: Called after node has been removed from Nodes collection.
member.param: Reference to the node that is removed.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CreateCells
member.summary: Creates new cells based on the columns defined on either parent node or the columns in tree control. Node must be parented so it can get reference to a parent tree control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Provides implementation for IComparable interface. This is used for sorting and it compares the Text property on nodes.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeMouseDown
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the node and a mouse button is pressed.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeMouseUp
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the node and a mouse button is released.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeMouseMove
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is moved over the node.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeMouseEnter
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse enters the node.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeMouseLeave
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse leaves the node.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeMouseHover
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse hovers over the node.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeClick
member.summary: Occurs when the node is clicked with left mouse button. If you need to know more information like if another mouse button is clicked etc. use NodeMouseDown event.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeDoubleClick
member.summary: Occurs when the node is double-clicked.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.MarkupLinkClick
member.summary: Occurs when hyperlink in text-markup is clicked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.HasChildNodes
member.summary: Gets whether node has child nodes.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets the context menu assigned to this node. Standard Context Menus, VS.NET 2005 Context Menus and DotNetBar Suite context menus are supported. Default value is null (Nothing) which indicates that no context menu is assigned.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.HasHostedControls
member.summary: Gets whether any of the cells inside the node has HostedControl property set.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodeRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets custom node renderer. You can set this property to your custom renderer. When set the RenderMode should be set to custom to enable your custom renderer. To choose one of the system renderer use RenderMode property. Default value is null.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the render mode used to render the node. Default value is eNodeRenderMode.Default which indicates that system default renderer is used. Note that if you specify custom renderer you need to set either AdvTree.NodeRenderer or Node.NodeRenderer property.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node is expanded. Expanded node shows it's child nodes.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Name
member.summary: Returns name of the node that can be used to identify it from the code.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.DragDropEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node can be dragged and dropped. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ExpandVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets visibility of the expand button. Default value is Auto meaning that expand button is displayed only if node has at least one child node.
member.remarks: You can use this property for example to dynamically load the child nodes when user tries to expand the node. You could for example handle BeforeExpand event to load child nodes into the node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.SizeChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether any operation on the node has been performed that would affect node's size. Size changed flag internally indicates that node's size needs to be recalculated because it has changed due to the changes in data.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.BoundsRelative
member.summary: Gets the relative bounds of the tree node including the expand part of the node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the absolute bounds of the tree node including the expand part of the node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ContentBounds
member.summary: Gets the node content bounds.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CellsBoundsRelative
member.summary: Gets the bounds for all the cells inside the node. The bounds do not include the expand part.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CellsBounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds for all the cells inside the node. The bounds do not include the expand part.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ChildNodesBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounds of child nodes.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ExpandPartRectangleRelative
member.summary: Gets the expand part rectangle. Expand part is used to expand/collapse node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ExpandPartRectangle
member.summary: Gets the expand part rectangle. Expand part is used to expand/collapse node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CommandBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the Command part bounds if command part is visible.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Checked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tree node is in a checked state.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CheckBoxAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the checkbox alignment in relation to the text displayed by first default cell.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CheckBoxVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box is visible inside the cell.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CheckBoxStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance style of the item. Default value is CheckBox. Item can also assume the style of radio-button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CheckBoxThreeState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the CheckBox will allow three check states rather than two. If the ThreeState property is set to true CheckState property should be used instead of Checked property to set the extended state of the control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CheckState
member.summary: Specifies the state of a control, such as a check box, that can be checked, unchecked, or set to an indeterminate state.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.FullPath
member.summary: Gets the path from the root tree node to the current tree node. The path consists of the labels of all the tree nodes that must be navigated to get to this tree node, starting at the root tree node. The node labels are separated by the delimiter character specified in the PathSeparator property of the Tree control that contains this node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Index
member.summary: Gets the zero based index of position of the tree node in the tree node collection. -1 is returned if node is not parented. If node is root node the index of node in AdvTree.Nodes collection is returned.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.IsEditing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the tree node is in an editable state. true if the tree node is in editable state; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.IsMouseDown
member.summary: Gets whether left mouse button is pressed on any cell contained by this node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.IsMouseOver
member.summary: Gets whether mouse cursor is over on any cell contained by this node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the tree node is in the selected state. true if the tree node is in the selected state; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Selectable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node can be selected by user by clicking it with the mouse or using keyboard. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CanSelect
member.summary: Gets whether node can be selected. Node must be Visible, Enabled and Selectable in order for it to be selected.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.SelectedCell
member.summary: Gets or sets a cell that is in selected state otherwise it returns null.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the tree node is visible. Node is considered to be visible when it's Visible property is set to true and path to the node is available i.e. all parent nodes are expanded.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.IsDisplayed
member.summary: Returns whether node is displayed on the screen and visible to the user. When node is outside of the viewable area this property will return false. It will also return false if node is not visible.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.LastNode
member.summary: Gets the last child tree node. The LastNode is the last child Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the current tree node. If the Node has no child tree node, the LastNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NextNode
member.summary: Gets the next sibling tree node. The NextNode is the next sibling Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the tree node's parent Node. If there is no next tree node, the NextNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NextVisibleNode
member.summary: Gets the next visible tree node. The NextVisibleNode can be a child, sibling, or a tree node from another branch. If there is no next tree node, the NextVisibleNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Level
member.summary: Gets the zero-based depth of the tree node in the tree control. The root node is considered the first level of nesting and returns 0.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Nodes
member.summary: Gets the collection of Node objects assigned to the current tree node. The Nodes property can hold a collection of other Node objects. Each of the tree node in the collection has a Nodes property that can contain its own NodeCollection. Nesting of tree nodes can make it difficult to navigate a tree structure. The FullPath property makes it easier to determine your location in a tree.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.AnyVisibleNodes
member.summary: Gets whether there is at least one child node that has its Visible property set to true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent tree node of the current tree node. If the tree node is at the root level, the Parent property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.PrevNode
member.summary: Gets the previous sibling tree node. The PrevNode is the previous sibling Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the tree node's parent Node. If there is no previous tree node, the PrevNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.PrevVisibleNode
member.summary: Gets the previous visible tree node. The PrevVisibleNode can be a child, sibling, or a tree node from another branch. If there is no previous tree node, the PrevVisibleNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.TagString
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.BindingIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the Binding index in CurrencyManager list if node is bound. You should not change this value directly since it is used internally by the control for data binding scenarios.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.DataKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains additional data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned. This property has same function as Tag property and provides you with additional separate storage of data.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.DataKeyString
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains additional data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned. This property has same function as Tag property and provides you with additional separate storage of data.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed in the tree node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.HostedControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the control hosted inside of the first node cell.

remarks.para: When control is hosted inside of the cell, cell size is determined by the size of the control hosted inside of it. The cell will not display its text but it will display any image assigned or check box when control is hosted inside of it. The Style settings like Margin and Padding will still apply.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.TreeControl
member.summary: Gets the parent tree control that the tree node is assigned to.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CellLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cells inside the node. Default value is Horizontal layout which means that cell are positioned horizontally next to each other.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CellPartLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cell parts like check box, image and text. Layout can be horizontal (default) where parts of the cell are positioned next to each other horizontally, or vertical where parts of the cell are positioned on top of each other vertically. Alignment of the each part is controlled by alignment properties. This property affects only the first cell inside of the node. Use Cell.Layout property to change the part layout on each cell contained by node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Cells
member.summary: Gets the collection of all Cells assigned to this node. There should be always at least one cell in a node which is default cell. Default collection contains a single cell.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodesColumnsHeaderVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column header for child nodes if defined is visible. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.HasColumns
member.summary: Gets whether node has child nodes columns defined.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.NodesColumns
member.summary: Get collection of child node columns.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.StyleExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the cells when node is expanded.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the node/cell or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.

remarks.para: When node is expanded the style specified here will be used on all cells associated with this node instead of the Cell.StyleNormal. That way you can give different appearance to your node's cells when node is expanded.
When property is set to null value the style setting from parent tree controls is used. NodeStyleExpanded on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.StyleExpandedName
member.summary: Gets or sets the expanded style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleExpanded property instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.StyleSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets the style used when Node is selected. Default value is NULL (VB Nothing)

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.StyleSelectedName
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleSelected property instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.StyleMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets the style used when mouse is over the Node. Default value is NULL (VB Nothing)

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.StyleMouseOverName
member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse over style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleMouseOver property instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the node style.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the node or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.

remarks.para: Style specified by this property will be used as default style for the node. Each cell within the node can also specify it's own style. Since node contains the cells using this style property can you for example create a border around all cell contained by the node.
When this property is set to null value (default value) NodeStyle property on AdvTree control is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.StyleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use Style property instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.MouseOverNodePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the part of the node mouse is over.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the node horizontal offset from the position determined by the layout manager.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the image alignment in relation to the text displayed by cell. This property affects only first default cell inside the node. Property with same name is available on each cell and you can use it to affect each cell individually.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node is enabled. Default value is true. Setting this value to false will set Enabled=false on all child cells.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed when the tree node is disabled. If image is not specified control will create gray-scale disabled image automatically.
member.remarks: Image specified will be used as image when node is disabled.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageDisabledIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the disabled image.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed when the tree node is in the unselected state.
member.remarks: Image specified will be used as a default image for any other node state where different image is not specified.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the default image that is displayed by the tree nodes.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed when mouse is over the tree node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageMouseOverIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the image that is displayed by the tree nodes when mouse is over the node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed when node is expanded.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageExpandedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the image that is displayed by the tree nodes when node is expanded.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ImageList
member.summary: Property Editor support for ImageIndex selection

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ParentConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between current node and its parent node. Default value is null which means that settings from AdvTree control are used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node is visible.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.CommandButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether command button is visible. Default value is false. Command button can be used to display for example popup menu with commands for node, or to display the list of linked nodes.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.SelectedConnectorMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets internal value that indicates that node is on "path" of the selected node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.FullRowBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets whether style background that is applied to the node is drawn across the width of the tree control instead of only behind the node content. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.ColumnHeaderHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the child column header height.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.AccessibleObject
member.summary: Gets the AccessibleObject assigned to the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.AccessibleDefaultActionDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the default action description of the control for use by accessibility client applications.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.AccessibleDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the control used by accessibility client applications.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.AccessibleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the control used by accessibility client applications.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.AccessibleRole
member.summary: Gets or sets the accessible role of the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.AdvTree.Node.IsAccessible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the node is visible to accessibility applications.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BalloonTip.BalloonControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal Balloon control that is used to display Balloon. This property will have valid value only during time Balloon is actually displayed on the screen. Value will also be valid during BalloonDisplaying event. You can use this property to further customize Balloon control before it is displayed to the user. You can also set it to your own instance of the Balloon control (or the control that is inheriting it) for ultimate customization options. Note that new instance of Balloon control is created each time Balloon needs to be displayed. Once Balloon is closed control is disposed.

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization
member.summary: Desribes interface that provides custom serialization support for items.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.InvokeSerializeItem(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs)
member.summary: Invokes SerializeItem event.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.InvokeDeserializeItem(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs)
member.summary: Invokes DeserializeItem event.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.HasSerializeItemHandlers
member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for SerializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance SerializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.HasDeserializeItemHandlers
member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for DeserializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance DeserializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.summary: Recalculates the layout of the Bar and repaints it. This will not change the size of the Bar it will only force the recalculation of the size for each contained item and it will repaint the bar. To ensure that Bar is resized if necessary as well call RecalcLayout method.

member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.TabStripStyleChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the TabStrip style which used on dockable windows has changed. This event gives you opportunity to change the style of the tab strip by accessing Bar.DockTabControl.Style property.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PreRender
member.summary: Occurs before the bar control is rendered. This event is fired once for each part of the bar control being rendered. Check the Part property of the event arguments to identify the part being rendered. You can cancel internal rendering by setting Cancel property.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PostRender
member.summary: Occurs after the bar control is rendered and allows you to render on top of the default rendering provided by the control.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.LocalizeString
member.summary: Occurs when DotNetBar is looking for translated text for one of the internal text that are displayed on menus, toolbars and customize forms. You need to set Handled=true if you want your custom text to be used instead of the built-in system value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the redering mode used by control. Default value is eRenderMode.Global which means that static GlobalManager.Renderer is used. If set to Custom then Renderer property must also be set to the custom renderer that will be used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom renderer used by the items on this control. RenderMode property must also be set to eRenderMode.Custom in order renderer specified here to be used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.FadeEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse over fade effect is enabled for buttons. Default value is false. Note that Fade effect will work only when Office2007 style is used. For other styles this property has no effect and fade animation is not used regardless this property setting.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.IsFadeEnabled
member.summary: Gets whether fade effect should be in use.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Bar back color.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CustomizeMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets the Bar customize menu (Applies to the bars with LayoutType set to DockWindow only).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoHideSide
member.summary: Indicates the auto-hide side of the parent form where bar is positioned.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoHideTabTextAlwaysVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab text is always visible while bar is in auto-hide state. Default value is false which indicates that only text for the active dock tab is visible.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoHide
member.summary: Indicates whether Bar is in auto-hide state. Applies to non-document dockable bars only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoHideVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the bar when bar is in auto-hide state.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanAutoHide
member.summary: Indicates whether Bar can be auto hidden.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.GlobalParentComponent
member.summary: Gets or sets the global parent control used as part of Global Items feature when bar is used as context menu bar. This property is used internally by DotNetBar and should not be set directly.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoHideAnimationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets how long it takes to play the auto-hide animation, in milliseconds. Maximum value is 2000, 0 disables animation.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.ToolTipVisible
member.summary: Gets whether tooltip is visible or not.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabControl
member.summary: Returns the reference to internal TabStrip control used to display contained DockContainerItems.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.SelectedDockContainerItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected DockContainerItem if bar represents dockable window.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.SelectedDockTab
member.summary: Gets or sets the tab (DockContainerItem) index for Bars with LayoutType set to eLayoutType.DockContainer. Index corresponds to the index of the DockContainerItem in Bar.Items collection.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Indicates Bar background image.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoCreateCaptionMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets whether caption button menu for bars with grab handle task pane is automatically created. Caption menu when automatically created will display the list of all items from Items collection and it will maintain only one item from the list as visible item. To create custom caption menu that is displayed when user clicks the caption button handle CaptionButtonClick event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoSyncBarCaption
member.summary: Gets or sets whether caption (text) of the bars with dock container layout is automatically set to the selected dock container item text.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanUndock
member.summary: Specifies whether Bar can be undocked. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanTearOffTabs
member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can tear-off (deattach) the tabs on dockable window.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanReorderTabs
member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can reorder the tabs on dockable window.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockTab
member.summary: Gets or sets whether bar or DockContainerItem that is torn-off this bar can be docked as tab to another bar. Default value is true which indicates that bar can be docked as tab to another bar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockTop
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Top dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockBottom
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Bottom dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockLeft
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Left dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockRight
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Right dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockDocument
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked as document. Default value is false. See DotNetBarManager.EnableDocumentDocking for more details.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.Stretch
member.summary: Specifies whether Bar will stretch to always fill the space in dock site. Applies to the dockable bars only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DisabledImagesGrayScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gray-scale algorithm is used to create automatic gray-scale images. Default is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockOffset
member.summary: Gets/Sets the distance from the far left/top side of the docking site or suggests the order of the docked bar. Upon serialization this property will contain actual left/top position of the bar. You can use it to re-order the bars docked on the same line. Property value is relative to the other bars docked on the same line when it is used to change the order. For example setting DockOffset value to 10 will place the bar just after the last bar on the same line that has DockOffset value less than 10. If there is no bar with DockOffset value less than 10 the bar will be placed in first position.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockLine
member.summary: Gets/Sets the dock line.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the dock tab alignment.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CloseSingleTab
member.summary: Gets or sets whether selected dock tab is closed when Bar caption close button is pressed. Default value is false which indicates that whole bar will be hidden when bars close button is pressed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabCloseButtonVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is displayed on each dock tab that allows closing of the tab. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AlwaysDisplayDockTab
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab that shows all dock containers on the bar is visible all the time. By default tab is hidden when there is only one item displayed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.LockDockPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether bar is locked to prevent docking below it. Applies to undockable bars only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockOrientation
member.summary: Gets/Sets the orientation of the Bar.

member.summary: Indicates whether Tooltips are shown on Bars and menus.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the item expands automatically to fill out the remaining space inside the container. Applies to Items on stretchable, no-wrap Bars only.

member.summary: Gets/Sets infromational text (tooltip) for the item.

member.summary: Returns name of the item that can be used to identify item from the code.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.GlobalName
member.summary: Gets or sets the global name of the item that is used to synchorize the Global properties for the item across all instances with same global name. Note that only instances that belong to the same control are synchronized. GlobalItem must be set to true to perform the synchoriznation. You can find more information and list of properties that are synchorized in help file.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.ShouldSyncProperties
member.summary: Gets whether global properties should synchronized.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.SupportedOrientation
member.summary: Gets orientation within container that is supported by this item. If item does not support certain orientation the container automatically hides it when container switches into that orientation.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.GlobalItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. Do not change the value of this property. It is managed by system only.

member.summary: Gets whether tooltip for the item is displayed.

member.summary: Gets whether tooltip is visible or not.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.OriginalBarName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the bar this item originated on. This is used to remember the originating bar when user is moving the items from bar to bar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.OriginalPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets item's original position (index) if item position has changed due to the user customization.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.UserCustomized
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that indicates whether item was customize by the end-user.

member.summary: Gets reference to the tooltip control if tooltip is displayed for this item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.summary: Gets or sets size of the images when button is enlarged, default value is 48 by 48 pixels. Note that you should provide the images in the same size for the buttons through the image properties on the buttons or through ImagesLarge property. If the large images are not provided the regular button image will be automatically enlarged.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BubbleBar.ImageSizeNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets the normal image size for the buttons, default value is 24 by 24 pixels. This should be set to the default image size that you will use on the buttons. If the images specified for the buttons are not of the same size as the size specified here then they will be automatically resized. Normal size must always be smaller than the size specified by ImageSizeLarge property.

member.summary: Creates the popup container control which is a parent/holder control for the controls you want to display on the popup. This method can be used if you do not wish to handle the PopupContainerLoad to add controls to the popup container. After calling this method you can access PopupContainerControl property to add your controls to be displayed on the popup.
member.param: Indicates whether PopupContainerLoad events are fired.

member.summary: Occurs when popup container is loading. Use this event to assign control to the popup container. If you want to use same control that you added to the popup container after popup is closed you must handle the PopupContainerUnload event and remove the control from the popup container so it is not disposed with the container.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.PopupItem.PopupContainerUnload
member.summary: Occurs when popup container is unloading. Use this event to save any state associated with the control that was contained by the container or to remove the control from the container so it is not disposed with container.

member.summary: Gets/Sets the image position inside the button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.CustomColorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the coresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property. Applies to items with Office 2007 style only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color of the button. Color specified applies to buttons with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. Default value is eButtonColor.Default

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ButtonStyle
member.summary: Gets/Sets the button style which controls the appearance of the button elements. Changing the property can display image only, text only or image and text on the button at all times.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.Icon
member.summary: Specifies the Button icon. Icons support multiple image sizes and alpha blending.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.Image
member.summary: Specifies the Button image.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ImageSmall
member.summary: Specifies the small Button image used by Ribbon control when small image variant is needed because of the automatic button resizing or because the button is on the Quick Access Toolbar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ImageListSizeSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets the image size that is used by the button when multiple ImageList controls are used as source for button image. By default ImageList assigned to Images property of parent control is used. Using this property you can selection ImagesMedium or ImagesLarge ImageList to be used as source for image for this button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.UseSmallImage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether button uses the ImageSmall as source of the image displayed on the button if ImageSmall is set to valid image. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ImageIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the image for the button if ImageList is used.

member.summary: Specifies the image for the button when mouse is over the item.

member.summary: Specifies the index of the image for the button when mouse is over the item when ImageList is used.

member.summary: Specifies the image for the button when mouse left button is pressed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.PressedImageIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the image for the button when mouse left button is pressed and ImageList is used.

member.summary: Specifies the image for the button when items Enabled property is set to false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.DisabledImageIndex

member.summary: Sets fixed size of the image. Image will be scaled and painted it size specified.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fixed size of the button. Both width and height must be set to value greater than 0 in order for button to use fixed size. Setting both width and height to 0 (default value) indicates that button will be sized based on content.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether button appears as split button. Split button appearance divides button into two parts. Image which raises the click event when clicked and text and expand sign which shows button sub items on popup menu when clicked. Button must have both text and image visible (ButtonStyle property) in order to appear as a full split button.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether button appears as split button. Split button appearance divides button into two parts. Image which raises the click event when clicked and text and expand sign which shows button sub items on popup menu when clicked. Button must have both text and image visible (ButtonStyle property) in order to appear as a full split button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonX.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the button will auto-expand when clicked. When button contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Gets or set a value indicating whether the button is in the checked state.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether control displays focus cues when focused.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonX.CustomColorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the corresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property. Applies to items with Office 2007 style only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonX.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color of the button. Color specified applies to buttons with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. Default value is eButtonColor.Default

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItemControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Indicates to control that all further update operations should not result in layout and refresh of control content. Use this method to optimize the addition of new items to the control. This method supports nested calls meaning that multiple calls are allowed but they must be ended with appropriate number of EndUpdate calls. IsUpdateSuspended property returns whether update is suspended.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the BackColor value you set is used instead of the style back color automatically provided by the control. member.summary: Gets or sets the keyboard search buffer expiration timeout. Default value is 1000 which indicates that key pressed within 1 second will add to the search buffer and control will be searched for node text that begins with resulting string. Setting this value to 0 will disable the search buffer.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of the drop-down portion of the ComboTreeBox control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.ComboTree.Nodes
member.summary: Gets the collection of tree nodes that are assigned to the popup tree view control.
member.value: A NodeCollection that represents the tree nodes assigned to the tree control.

remarks.para: The Nodes property holds a collection of Node objects, each of which has a Nodes property that can contain its own NodeCollection.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.ComboTree.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of column headers that appear in the popup tree.

remarks.para: By default there are no column headers defined. In that case tree control functions as regular tree control where text has unrestricted width.
If you want to restrict the horizontal width of the text but not display column header you can create one column and set its width to the width desired and set its Visible property to false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.ComboTree.ColumnsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column headers are visible if they are defined through Columns collection. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.ComboTree.GridColumnLines
member.summary: Gets or sets whether grid lines are displayed when columns are defined. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.ComboTree.GridLinesColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the grid lines color.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.ComboTree.GridRowLines
member.summary: Gets or sets whether horizontal grid lines between each row are displayed. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.ComboTree.HotTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node is highlighted when mouse enters the node. Default value is false.
member.remarks: There are two ways to enable the node hot-tracking. You can set the HotTracking property to true in which case the mouse tracking is enabled using system colors specified in TreeColorTable. You can also define the NodeStyleMouseOver style which gets applied to the node when mouse is over the node.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ResetOnPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how an input character that matches the prompt character should be handled. The default is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ResetOnSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how a space input character should be handled. member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.AutoCompleteMode
member.summary: Gets or sets an option that controls how automatic completion works for the TextBox. One of the values of AutoCompleteMode. The values are Append, None, Suggest, and SuggestAppend. The default is None.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.AutoCompleteSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the source of complete strings used for automatic completion. One of the values of AutoCompleteSource. The options are AllSystemSources, AllUrl, FileSystem, HistoryList, RecentlyUsedList, CustomSource, and None. The default is None.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.CharacterCasing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the TextBox control modifies the case of characters as they are typed. One of the CharacterCasing enumeration values that specifies whether the TextBox control modifies the case of characters. The default is CharacterCasing.Normal.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.PasswordChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to mask characters of a password in a single-line TextBox control. The character used to mask characters entered in a single-line TextBox control. Set the value of this property to 0 (character value) if you do not want the control to mask characters as they are typed. Equals 0 (character value) by default.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.TextAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets how text is aligned in a TextBox control. One of the HorizontalAlignment enumeration values that specifies how text is aligned in the control. The default is HorizontalAlignment.Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.UseSystemPasswordChar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text in the TextBox control should appear as the default password character. true if the text in the TextBox control should appear as the default password character; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.HideSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selected text in the text box control remains highlighted when the control loses focus. true if the selected text does not appear highlighted when the text box control loses focus; false, if the selected text remains highlighted when the text box control loses focus. The default is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.MaxLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of characters the user can type or paste into the text box control. The number of characters that can be entered into the control. The default is 32767.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.Modified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates that the text box control has been modified by the user since the control was created or its contents were last set. true if the control's contents have been modified; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxDropDown.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether text in the text box is read-only. true if the text box is read-only; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of characters selected in the text box. The number of characters selected in the text box.

member.summary: Gets or sets the starting point of text selected in the text box. The starting position of text selected in the text box.

member.summary: Gets the length of text in the control.Returns number of characters contained in the text of the control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Indicates to control that all further update operations should not result in layout and refresh of control content. Use this method to optimize the addition of new items to the control. This method supports nested calls meaning that multiple calls are allowed but they must be ended with appropriate number of EndUpdate calls. IsUpdateSuspended property returns whether update is suspended.

member.summary: Specifies the index of the Tab image if ImageList is used. Image specified here is used only on Tab when there are multiple dock containers on Bar.

member.summary: Specifies the Button icon. Icons support multiple image sizes and alpha blending.

member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined tab color. Default value is eTabItemColor.Default which means that default color is used.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab that dock container item is on is selected.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the item in pixels.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the item in pixels.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the item. When used please note that layout logic for dockable windows expects that all DockContainerItems that are in particular docking side have exact same minimum size. When setting this property it is best to set the same value for all DockContainerItem instances you create.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.DefaultFloatingSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default floating size of the Bar that is containing this item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.MinFormClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the form client area that is tried to maintain when dockable window is resized.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the item expands automatically to fill out the remaining space inside the container. Applies to Items on stretchable, no-wrap Bars only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item can be customized by end user.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.DesignMode
member.summary: Returns whether item is in design mode or not.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.GlobalItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.summary: Sets the width of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Width can be set only if parent container has Horizontal orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If width is less than minimum width bar's width will be set to minimum width.

member.summary: Sets the height of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Height can be set only if parent container has vertical orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If height is less than minimum height bar's height will be set to minimum height.

However, under certain circumstances you might need DotNetBar to load definition right away so you can access bars and items. We recommend moving the code to Form Load event and leaving the loading process for DotNetBar definition as is.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.GetItems(System.String,System.Type,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockTabClosing
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.summary: Gets whether component has been disposed.
member.remarks: Disposed will return true after Dispose method has been executed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DisposeGCCollect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether GC.Collect() is called when this component is disposed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.MinimumClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum client size that docking windows will try to maintain for the client area (not occupied by dock windows). Note that this value is suggested value and cannot be observed when form is resized below the minimum size required for the given layout. Default value is 48x48 pixels.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockingHintsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether DotNetBar provides docking hints for easy docking of bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.EnableFullSizeDock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can control how first bar is docked when using docking hints (default value is True). When enabled (default value) placing the mouse over the middle docking hint will dock the bar at partial size and using the far docking hint will dock bar at full size. Full size indicates that dock site which hosts the bar consumes all the space of the parent form while partial size indicates that dock site consumes the full size minus the space of the other dock sites. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ApplyDocumentBarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether uniform styling is applied to bars docked as documents. Default value is true which means that bar that will be docked as document will have it's style changed so it fits in default document styling. Such bars will have GrabHandleStyle=None, DockTabAlignment=Top and AlwaysDisplayDockTab=true. Set this property to false to have bars keep these properties once they are docked as documents. Value of these properties will be returned back to the default values once bar is not docked as document.

member.summary: Returns whether definition is being currently loaded.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IncludeDockDocumentsInDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether document bars are saved in definition file. Default value is false which means that document bars are not saved as part of definition file. You can set this value to true to save document bar to definition file and be able to load them.
member.remarks: Note that by default Document bars that you created during design-time get member variables assigned to them by Windows Forms designer. If you decide to save definition of such bars and load definition back member variables will not point to correct bar instances since loading definition recreates all bars from scratch. You should always use Bars collection to access bars when saving and loading definitions.

member.summary: Gets or sets Color scheme for all bars. Note that you need to set UseGlobalColorScheme to true to indicate that this ColorScheme object will be used on all bars managed by this instance of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.UseGlobalColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets whether ColorScheme object on DotNetBarManager is used as a default ColorScheme for all bars managed by DotNetBarManager. Default value is false which indicates that ColorScheme on each Bar is used. When set to true each bar will use the ColorScheme settings from DotNetBarManager and it will ignore any setting on the Bar.ColorScheme object.

member.summary: Indicates whether the Personalized menu setting is ignored and full menus are always shown.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput._ShowUpDown
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a spin button control (up-down control) is used to adjust the date/time value. The default is false.
When the ShowUpDown property is set to true, a spin button control is shown to adjust value of currently focused input item. The date and time can be adjusted by selecting each element individually and using the up and down buttons to change the value.

member.summary: Occurs when ShowCheckBox property is set to true and user changes the lock status of the control by clicking the check-box.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the selected date. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the selected date; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the date in the control. When the check box is selected, the date/time value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the date/time value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the date time value of the control. You can use IsEmpty property to check whether control holds an empty value. Setting this property to System.DateTime(0) will also make the control Empty if AllowEmptyState=true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.ValueObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time value of the control as an object. This property allows you to bind to the database fields and supports null values. Expected value is DateTime object or null to indicate no date selected.

Gets or sets the values of the nested DateTimeGroup items.
When nested date-time groups are used note that some of the features of the control are disabled, notably minimum and maximum values for nested date-times.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether empty null/nothing state of the control is allowed. Default value is true which means that IsEmpty property may return true if input value is resets or ValueObject set to null/nothing.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format date/time is displayed in. To specify custom format set this value to Custom and specify custom format using CustomFormat property.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.CustomFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom date/time format string.
member.remarks:
To display string literals that contain date and time separators or format strings listed below, you must use escape characters in the substring. For example, to display the date as "June 15 at 12:00 PM", set the CustomFormat property to "MMMM dd 'at' t:mm tt". If the "at" substring is not enclosed by escape characters, the result is "June 15 aP 12:00PM" because the "t" character is read as the one-letter A.M./P.M. format string (see the format string table below).
To display single quote in custom format use two single quotes characters like so '' after each other and they will be displayed as single quote.
The following list shows all the valid format strings and their descriptions:
Format String Description
d The one- or two-digit day.
dd The two-digit day. Single-digit day values are preceded by a 0.
ddd The three-character day-of-week abbreviation.
dddd The full day-of-week name.
jjj The three-digit day-of-year day. Single and two-digit values are preceded by 0.
j The three-digit day-of-year day.
h The one- or two-digit hour in 12-hour format.
hh The two-digit hour in 12-hour format. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
H The one- or two-digit hour in 24-hour format.
HH The two-digit hour in 24-hour format. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
m The one- or two-digit minute.
mm The two-digit minute. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
M The one- or two-digit month number.
MM The two-digit month number. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
MMM The three-character month abbreviation.
MMMM The full month name.
s The one- or two-digit seconds.
ss The two-digit seconds. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
t The one-letter A.M./P.M. abbreviation (A.M. is displayed as "A").
tt The two-letter A.M./P.M. abbreviation (A.M. is displayed as "AM").
y The one-digit year (2001 is displayed as "1").
yy The last two digits of the year (2001 is displayed as "01").
yyyy The full year (2001 is displayed as "2001").
{ Starts the nested date-time group inside of the control. Note that nested groups must always be closed. Nested date-time groups can be used to represent range of input date/time values in the control To access nested values use Values property. For example to have control represent the input from two time values you could set CustomFormat to 'from' {HH:mm} 'to' {HH:mm} which will create two nested date/time groups that represent the time value. Entered time values can be accessed through Values property which return an array of all input values.
} Ends the nested date-time input group.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SetSelectionRange(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.
member.param: The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.
member.exception:
startDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
startDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-
endDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or- endDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
member.remarks: If the startDate value is greater than endDate property value, the dates are swapped; the endDate value becomes the starting date, and startDate value becomes the end date.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.DateSelected
member.summary:
Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
This event is similar to the DateChanged event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. You should handle this event when you enable multiple date selection through MultiSelect property and want to be notified after the date selection has been made. DateChanged event would fire each time selection changes during the selection of multiple dates.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.
Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the SetSelectionRange method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the SelectionRange.Start or SelectionRange.End property values of the SelectionRange property. You should use SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, or SetSelectionRange. If the Start property value of the SelectionRange is greater than its End property value, the dates are swapped; the End property value becomes the starting date, and Start property value becomes the end date.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is automatically resized to display its entire contents. You can set MaximumSize.Width property to set the maximum width used by the control.

member.summary: Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.
member.param: The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.
member.exception:
startDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
startDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-
endDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or- endDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
member.remarks: If the startDate value is greater than endDate property value, the dates are swapped; the endDate value becomes the starting date, and startDate value becomes the end date.
