member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.DateSelected
member.summary:
Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
This event is similar to the DateChanged event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. You should handle this event when you enable multiple date selection through MultiSelect property and want to be notified after the date selection has been made. DateChanged event would fire each time selection changes during the selection of multiple dates.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SelectionRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.
Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the SetSelectionRange method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the SelectionRange.Start or SelectionRange.End property values of the SelectionRange property. You should use SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, or SetSelectionRange. If the Start property value of the SelectionRange is greater than its End property value, the dates are swapped; the End property value becomes the starting date, and Start property value becomes the end date.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyFontStyle(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style text and box properties but not any background or border properties to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.param: Style to apply to this style

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyStyle(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.remarks: This method is used to support style hierarchies where a base style is defined and inherited/child styles are derived and based on it. By using this method on the base style you can apply only style changes defined by the child style. For example if you defined a base style for normal user interface element then in most cases you do not want to redefine the styling for the case when same user interface element is selected. You will just defined the behavior of the selected state and then apply it to the base normal style using ApplyStyle method.
member.param: Style to apply to current style.

member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to the object customize menu will be acting on. This could be an ButtonItem or any BaseItem derived class as well as RibbonBar object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to the popup menu that will be displayed. You can change the members of SubItems collection to add/remove/change the context menu items that will be displayed.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonCustomizeEventArgs.#ctor(System.Object,Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem)
member.summary: Creates new instance of the object and initializes it with default values.
member.param: Reference to popup menu item if any.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the closing of the ribbon menu is canceled.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object that was cause of the menu closing. For example this could be reference to an item that was clicked. Default value is null which indicates that there is no information about the object that caused closing available.

remarks.para: Following is the possible list of types that this property could be set to and causes for closing:

list.item: BaseItem - when an item is clicked the Source will be set to the instance of the item that was clicked.
RibbonControl - when parent form RibbonControl is on loses the input focus the Source will be set to the RibbonControl

RibbonTabItem - when tab menu is displayed and user clicks the same tab to close the menu. The RibbonTabItem with EventSource=Code will be also set as source when user double-clicks the tab to maximize the ribbon.
Any other type if RibbonControl.PopupRibbon method is called by your code.

member.summary: Gets or sets the source of the event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor2 property.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SuspendLayoutDisplay
member.summary: Suspends the layout and painting of the control. When you want to perform multiple operations on the explorer bar and you want to ensure that layout of the items on it and painting is not performed for performance and appearance reasons set this property to true. Once you want to enable layout and painting set the property back to false and call RecalcLayout method. Default value is false.

member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XmlElement.
member.param: XmlElement object that will act as a parent for the layout definition. Exact same element should be passed into the LoadLayout method to load the layout.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.LoadLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.LoadLayout(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.
member.param: Parent XML element that is used to load layout from. Note that this must be the same element that was passed into the SaveLayout method.

member.summary: Suspends normal layout logic.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.ResumeLayout(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resumes normal layout logic. Optionally forces an immediate layout of pending layout requests.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.ShowMoreButtons
member.summary: Increases the size of the navigation bar if possible by showing more buttons on the top.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.ShowFewerButtons
member.summary: Reduces the size of the navigation bar if possible by showing fewer buttons on the top.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.SaveLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XML based file.
member.param: File name to save layout to.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.SaveLayout(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XmlElement.
member.param: XmlElement object that will act as a parent for the layout definition. Exact same element should be passed into the LoadLayout method to load the layout.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.PopupSelectedPane
member.summary: Popup selected pane when control is collapsed. When control is collapsed (Expanded=false) currently selected pane is not visible calling this method will popup selected pane and allow user access to it. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.HideSelectedPopupPane
member.summary: Hides popup selected pane when control is collapsed and selected pane is displayed as popup. When control is collapsed (Expanded=false) currently selected pane can be displayed as popup. Calling this method will hide the popup pane. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.LoadLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.LoadLayout(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.
member.param: Parent XML element that is used to load layout from. Note that this must be the same element that was passed into the SaveLayout method.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.ColorSchemeStyleChanged
member.summary: Updates the color scheme on child panels to reflect the style of the NavigationBar control. Calling this method is necessary only if you manually change the NavigationBar.ColorScheme property.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether navigation pane can be collapsed. Default value is false. When set to true expand/collapse button will be displayed in title so control can be reduced in size.

member.summary: Gets or sets alignment of the expand button inside of title bar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether navigation pane is expanded. Default value is true. When control is collapsed it is reduced in size so it consumes less space.

member.summary: Gets the reference to the inner panel displaying Navigation Pane vertical text created when control is collapsed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.PopupSelectedPaneVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether selected pane is displayed as popup when control is collapsed (Expanded=false). Using navigation pane button that is displayed when control is collapsed user can popup or close currently selected pane without expanding the control. You can use this property to do same from code as well as check whether selected pane is displayed as popup. Note that control must be collapsed (Expanded=false) in order for this property to have any effect.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ProgressBarItem.ProgressType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of progress bar used to indicate progress. The Standard style displays the progress based on Minimum, Maximum and current Value. The Marquee type is automatically moving progress bar that is used to indicate an ongoing operation for which the actual duration cannot be estimated.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ProgressBarItem.MarqueeAnimationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the marquee animation speed in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ProgressBarItem.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color state table for progress bar. Color specified applies to items with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. You can use ColorTable to indicate the state of the operation that Progress Bar is tracking. Default value is eProgressBarItemColor.Normal.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.GetClass(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the instance of the ElementStyle with given class name or null if there is no class with that name defined.
member.param: Class name. See static members of ElementStyleClassKeys class for the list of available keys.
member.returns: Instance of ElementStyle for given class name or null if class cannot be found.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eButtonColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in ButtonItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on RibbonBar control. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.MenuButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on menu bar. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in RibbonTabItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabGroupColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabGroupColorTableCollection objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab groups with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabGroupColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements.

member.summary: Returns the color scheme table was initialized with.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the container. Either Width or Height can be set or both. Default value is 0,0 which means that size is automatically calculated.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.BackgroundStyle
member.summary: Specifies the container background style. Default value is an empty style which means that container does not display any background. BeginGroup property set to true will override this style on some styles.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.MultiLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items in horizontal layout are wrapped into the new line when they cannot fit allotted container size. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ItemSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets spacing in pixels between items. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. Do not change the value of this property. It is managed by system only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Bounds
member.summary: IBlock member implementation

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is expanded or not. For Popup items this would indicate whether the item is popped up or not.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.SystemContainer
member.summary: Returns whether instance of the item container is used as system container internally by DotNetBar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.AccessibleRole
member.summary: Gets or sets the accessible role of the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.AutoCollapseOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-collapse (fold) when clicked. When item is on popup menu and this property is set to false, menu will not close when item is clicked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item can be customized by end user.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Category
member.summary: Returns category for this item. If item cannot be customzied using the customize dialog category is empty string.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ClickAutoRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Click event will be auto repeated when mouse button is kept pressed over the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ClickRepeatInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the auto-repeat interval for the click event when mouse button is kept pressed over the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Cursor
member.summary: Specifes the mouse cursor displayed when mouse is over the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets item description. This description is displayed in Customize dialog to describe the item function in an application.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is enabled.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.GlobalItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets item alignment inside the container.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Shortcuts
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of shortcut keys associated with the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ShowSubItems

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. GalleryContainer automatically manages the layout orientation and this property should not be changed from its default value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.MultiLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items in horizontal layout are wrapped into the new line when they cannot fit allotted container size. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupUsesStandardScrollbars
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery when on popup is using standard scrollbars to scroll the content. Standard scrollbars are displayed on right hand side of the Gallery. Default value for this property is true. When set to false the scroll buttons are displayed only when needed and two buttons on top and bottom of the Gallery are used to indicate the scrolling possiblity and enable scrolling. Buttons are only visible when needed. This scrolling button style can be used for example on Application Menu to enable scrolling of list of most recently used files.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.IncrementalSizing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery is using incremental sizing when stretched. Default value is true. Incremental sizing will resize the width of the gallery so it fits completely the items it can contain in available space. That means that gallery will occupy enough space to display the whole items within available space. When set to false, it indicates that gallery will resize to fill all available space.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.StretchGallery
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery width is determined based on the RibbonBar width. This property is in effect when Gallery is hosted directly the RibbonBar control. Default value is false. When set to true the Gallery size is changed as the RibbonBar control is resized. The initial size of the Gallery is determined by DefaultSize property. The MinimumSize property specifies the minimum size of the Gallery. Note that only single Gallery can be stretched per RibbonBar control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGalleryItems
member.summary: Gets the collection of the items that are added to the popup gallery. The items displayed on the gallery are combined with the items from this collection and they are displayed on the gallery popup. This collection can for example have items that are customizing the choices of the commands in gallery etc.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.DefaultSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery. The gallery height will be always enforced so all scroll buttons can be displayed. Gallery width should allow display of both scroll buttons and the gallery content.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGallerySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery when gallery is displayed on the popup menu.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.EnableGalleryPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery can be displayed on the popup. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is expanded or not. For Popup items this would indicate whether the item is popped up or not.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.IsGalleryPopupOpen
member.summary: Gets whether the Gallery popup is open.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ScrollAnimation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether scroll animation is enabled. Default value is true. Scroll animation will be disabled if gallery is running under Remote Windows Terminal session or fade animation effect is disabled on the container control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.GalleryGroups
member.summary: Gets the collection of GalleryGroup objects associated with this gallery. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more items that are part of the GalleryContainer. Groups are used to visually group the items when gallery is displayed on the popup.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Accessible name for the Dialog Launcher button

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.BackgroundMouseOverStyle
member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control when mouse is over the control. Style specified here will be applied to the BackgroundStyle.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button in ribbon title bar. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherMouseOverButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button when mouse is over the button. Note that if this property is set you also must set the DialogLauncherButton property. Images set to both properties must have same size. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.MaximumOverflowTextLength
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum text length for automatic overflow button text. When overflow button is created due to the reduced size of the control text for the button can be specified using OverflowButtonText property. If text is not specified RibbonBar.Text property is used as overflow button text. In that case this property specifies maximum length of the text to display on the button. Default value is 25. You can set this property to 0 to use complete text regardless of length.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeOrderIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets resize order index of the control. When control is parented to RibbonPanel control (which is the case when control is used as part of RibbonControl) index specified here indicates the order in which controls that are part of the same panel are resized. Lower index value indicates that control should be resized later when size needs to be reduced or earlier when size needs to be increased. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.AutoOverflowEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether automatic overflow handling is enabled. When overflow is enabled if control is resized below the size that is needed to display its complete content overflow button is created and all content is moved to the overflow button popup. Control will only display overflow button when in this state and user can click overflow button to display the actual content of the control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the Image for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button. This Image is also used when RibbonBar is added to the Quick Access Toolbar to identify the RibbonBar button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether dialog launcher button is visible in title of the ribbon. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets default layout orientation inside the control. You can have multiple layouts inside of the control by adding one or more instances of the ItemContainer object and changing it's LayoutOrientation property.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ItemSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets spacing in pixels between items. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPanel.DefaultLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets whether default control layout is used instead of Rendering layout for RibbonBar controls positioning. By default internal layout logic is used so proper resizing of Ribbons can be performed. You can disable internal layout by setting this property to true. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPanel.UseCustomStyle

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.LocalizeString
member.summary: Occurs when DotNetBar is looking for translated text for one of the internal text that are displayed on menus, toolbars and customize forms. You need to set Handled=true if you want your custom text to be used instead of the built-in system value.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeQatCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Occurs before Quick Access Toolbar dialog is displayed. This event provides the opportunity to cancel the showing of built-in dialog and display custom customization dialog. You can also set the Dialog property of the event arguments to the custom dialog you want used instead of the DotNetBar system customization dialog.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AfterQatCustomizeDialog

member.summary: Occurs after selected RibbonPanel is displayed on popup while ribbon is collapsed.

member.summary: Occurs after RibbonPanel popup is closed.

member.summary: Occurs when text markup link from TitleText markup is clicked. Markup links can be created using "a" tag, for example: Markup link

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ExpandedChanged
member.summary: Occurs after Expanded property has changed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatFrequentCommands
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Quick Access Toolbar Frequently used commands. You should add existing buttons to this collection that you already have on the RibbonBar controls or on the application menu. The list will be used to construct the frequently used menu that is displayed when Customize Quick Access Toolbar menu is displayed and it allows end-user to remove and add these frequently used commands to the QAT directly from this menu. Note that items you add here should not be items that are already on Quick Access Toolbar, i.e. in RibbonControl.QuickToolbarItems collection.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.KeyTipsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether KeyTips functionality is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AllowMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets whether merge functionality is enabled for the control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control height is set automatically based on the content. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption and quick access toolbar provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStripIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.FadeEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse over fade effect is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.KeyTipsFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font that is used to display Key Tips (accelerator keys) when they are displayed. Default value is null which means that control Font is used for Key Tips display.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroups
member.summary: Collection of RibbonTabItemGroup items. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more RibbonTabItem object through the RibbonTabItem.Group property to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 10 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.DefaultGroupFont
member.summary: Gets or sets default font for tab groups. This font will be used if font is not specified by group style element.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BackgroundStyle
member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.SelectedRibbonTabItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected RibbonTabItem. RibbonTabItems are selected using the Checked property. Only a single RibbonTabItem can be selected (Checked) at any given time.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStrip
member.summary: Returns reference to internal ribbon strip control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Items
member.summary: Returns collection of items on a bar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QuickToolbarItems
member.summary: Returns collection of quick toolbar access and caption items.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Style
member.summary: Gets/Sets the visual style of the control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Office2007ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the Office 2007 Renderer global Color Table. Setting this property will affect all controls on the form that are using Office 2007 global renderer.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.IsPopupMode
member.summary: Gets whether collapsed ribbon is displaying the selected ribbon panel as popup.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is expanded or not. When control is expanded both the tabs and the tab ribbons are visible. When collapsed only tabs are visible.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AutoExpand
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is collapsed when RibbonTabItem is double clicked and expanded when RibbonTabItem is clicked. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Images
member.summary: ImageList for images used on Items. Images specified here will always be used on menu-items and are by default used on all Bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ImagesMedium
member.summary: ImageList for medium-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ImagesLarge
member.summary: ImageList for large-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.MdiSystemItemVisible
member.summary: Specifies whether the MDI system buttons are displayed in ribbon strip when MDI Child window is maximized.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CanSupportGlass
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Ribbon control employs the Windows Vista Glass support when available. This is managed automatically by Ribbon Control and no setting is necessary on your part.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control can be customized and items added by end-user using context menu to the quick access toolbar. Caption of the control must be visible for customization to be enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.UseExternalCustomization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether external implementation for ribbon bar and menu item customization will be used for customizing the ribbon control. When set to true it enables the displaying of RibbonBar and menu item context menus which allow customization. You are responsible for adding the menu items to context menu to handle all aspects of item customization. See "Ribbon Control Quick Access Toolbar Customization" topic in help file under How To. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.EnableQatPlacement

This method is useful for example when switching the color tables for Office 2007 renderer. member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the open forms that are tracked by Application.OpenForms collection. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on all open forms. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ApplyOffice2007ColorTable
member.summary: Applies current Office 2007 style color table set on GlobalManager.Renderer to all DotNetBar controls with Office 2007 style on all open forms.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on given form. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on all open forms. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ApplyOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Applies current Office 2007 style color table to all DotNetBar controls on the form.
member.param: Reference to the form or parent control that contains DotNetBar controls you would like to apply color table to.

member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 14 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonTabItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the coresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabGroupColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabGroupColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property.

member.summary: Occurs when text markup link is clicked. Markup links can be created using "a" tag, for example: Markup link

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.MaximumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the super tooltip. Default value is 0 which indicates that maximum width is not used. The maximum width property will not be used if custom size is specified.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.IgnoreFormActiveState
member.summary: Gets or sets whether form active state is ignored when control is deciding whether to show tooltip. By default this property is set to false which indicates that tooltip will be shown only if parent form is active. When set to true the form active state is ignored when deciding whether to show tooltip.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SuperTooltip will be shown for the controls assigned to it. Default value is true. You can set this property to false to disable SuperTooltip for all controls assigned to it.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.ShowTooltipImmediately
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip is shown immediately after the mouse enters the control. The default value is false which indicates that tooltip is shown after system hover timeout has expired which provides slight delay before tooltip is shown.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.MinimumTooltipSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum tooltip size. Default value is 150 width and 24 height.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.TooltipDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration in seconds that tooltip is kept on screen after it is displayed. Default value is 20 seconds. You can set this value to 0 to keep tooltip displayed until user moves mouse out of control or application loses focus.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DelayTooltipHideDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay time for hiding the tooltip in milliseconds after mouse has left the control. Default value is 0 which means that tooltip will be hidden as soon as mouse leaves the control tooltip was displayed for. You can use this property to provide the user with enough time to move the mouse cursor to the tooltip so user can act on the content of the tooltip, like hyper links.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.CheckOnScreenPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip position is checked before tooltip is displayed and adjusted to tooltip always falls into screen bounds. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.CheckTooltipPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip position is checked before tooltip is displayed and adjusted so tooltip does not overlaps the control it is displayed for. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.PositionBelowControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip position in relationship to the control tooltip is providing information for. Set this property to false if you want tooltip to be displayed below the mouse cursor. Default value is true which indicates that tooltip is displayed below mouse cursor but it is positioned below the control that it provides the information for so it is not covering its content.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultTooltipSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets default setting for new Tooltips you create in design time. If all your tooltips have common elements you can change this property to reflect these default setting before you start writing tooltips for all controls on the form. As you start creating new tooltips for controls on the form default values specified here will be used as starting values for new tooltip you are creating.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultSuperTooltipInfo
member.summary: Returns instance of default tooltip information used in design-time.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.SuperTooltipInfoTable
member.summary: Gets the reference to internal Hashtable that contains reference to all controls and assigned SuperTooltips. This collection must not be modified directly and it is automatically managed by the SuperTooltip component. You can use it for example to change the color for all SuperTooltips managed by the component but you should not add or remove items to it. Instead use SetSuperTooltip methods to add or remove the tooltip for a component.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.IsTooltipVisible
member.summary: Returns whether tooltip is visible.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.SuperTooltipControl
member.summary: Gets reference to instance of tooltip control if any has been created at the time call is made.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultFont
member.summary: Gets or sets default tooltip font. Default value is null which means that default system font is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.ShowTooltipDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets whether complete tooltip is shown including header, body and footer. Default value is true. When set to false only tooltip header will be shown. Providing this option to your end users as part of your application setting allows them to customize the level of information displayed and reduce it after they are familiar with your product.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.ShowTooltipForFocusedControl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip is shown when control that tooltip is assigned to is focused. You can set this value to false to disable Tooltip display when control receives input focus. Default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is effective only when Super Tooltip is assigned to the controls that inherit from System.Windows.Forms.Control class and it relies on Focused property of respective control for proper function.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ISuperTooltipInfoProvider.DisplayTooltip
member.summary: This event should be triggered by the component when it wants to display SuperTooltip. Normally this event would be equivalent of MouseHover event but you can trigger it in response to anything else. Sender for this event must be object that implements ISuperTooltipInfoProvider interface.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ISuperTooltipInfoProvider.HideTooltip
member.summary: This event should be triggered by component when it wants to hide SuperTooltip. For example this event might be triggered when mouse leaves your component. Sender of this event must be object that implements ISuperTooltipInfoProvider interface.

member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the scroll bar control. A numeric value that is within the Minimum and Maximum range. The default value is 0. ArgumentOutOfRangeException is raised if assigned value is less than the Minimum property value or assigned value is greater than the Maximum property value.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the redering mode used by control. Default value is eRenderMode.Global which means that static GlobalManager.Renderer is used. If set to Custom then Renderer property must also be set to the custom renderer that will be used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom renderer used by the items on this control. RenderMode property must also be set to eRenderMode.Custom in order renderer specified here to be used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.Appearance
member.summary: Gets or sets visual appearance for the control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.UsingSystemColors
member.summary: Gets or sets whether flat side bar is using system colors.
member.remarks: This property is used internally by side bar to determine whether to reset color scheme based on system colors. If you want side bar to use system colors you need to set PredefinedColorScheme property.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether tabs use anti-alias smoothing when painted. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tab scrolling is animated.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.AutoHideSystemBox
member.summary: Gets or sets whether system box that enables scrolling and closing of the tabs is automatically hidden when tab items size does not exceed the size of the control.

member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can reorder the tabs.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.AutoCloseTabs
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab is automatically closed when close button is clicked. Closing the tab will remove tab being closed from Tabs collection and it will remove the panel as well. Default value is false which means that tab will not be closed and you should handle TabClose event to perform desired action as result of user closing the tab.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Close button that closes the active tab is visible on system box.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is visible on each tab instead of in system box.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsAlwaysDisplayed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button on tabs when visible is displayed for every tab state. Default value is true. When set to false the close button will be displayed only for selected and tab that mouse is currently over.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the close button displayed on each tab. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button that allows user to close the tab. Use TabCloseButtonHot property to specify image that is used when mouse is over the close button. Note that image size must be same for both images. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonHot
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button whem mouse is over the close button. To use this property you must set TabCloseButtonNormal as well. Note that image size for both images must be same. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.DisplaySelectedTextOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether only selected tab is displaying it's text.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image list used by tab items.

member.summary: Gets or sets scrolling offset of the first tab. You can use this property to programmatically scroll the tab strip.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected tab.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether tabs are scrolled continuously while mouse is pressed over the scroll tab button.

member.summary: Gets or sets the auto-repeat interval for the tab scrolling while mouse button is kept pressed over the scroll tab button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.CloseButtonVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Close button that closes the active tab is visible.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.CloseButtonOnTabsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is visible on each tab instead of in system box.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.CloseButtonOnTabsAlwaysDisplayed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button on tabs when visible is displayed for every tab state. Default value is true. When set to false the close button will be displayed only for selected and tab that mouse is currently over.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.CloseButtonPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the close button displayed on each tab. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.TabCloseButtonNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button that allows user to close the tab. Use TabCloseButtonHot property to specify image that is used when mouse is over the close button. Note that image size must be same for both images. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.TabCloseButtonHot
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button whem mouse is over the close button. To use this property you must set TabCloseButtonNormal as well. Note that image size for both images must be same. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WizardPage.InteriorPage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether page is interior page. Interior pages use wizard header area to display page title, description and optional image. They are also padded and do not fill the client area of the Wizard. Default value is true. You can set this value to false to hide header area and make page fill the client area of the wizard.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WizardPage.Visible
